summary: For at least 7 years, EPA’s Office of Inspector General and its Office of Homeland Security—set up after 9/11 to address terrorism threats—have clashed over responsibility for certain national security matters. In May 2019, EPA finalized a new policy on intelligence operations, in part to help improve the offices’ working relations on these issues. We found that the offices’ key activities seldom overlap, except when...
title: Environmental Protection Agency: Recent Policy Could Improve Working Relations between EPA's Office of Inspector General and Office of Homeland Security
